contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary}} '''Falsification''' may refer to: * The act of disproving a proposition, hypothesis, or theory: see [[Falsifiability]] * [[Mathematical proof]] * [[Falsified evidence]] * Falsification of history, distortion of the historical record also known as [[Historical revisionism (negationism)]] * [[cpuinfo falsification]], a lowest common denominator technique to provide backwards compatibility in computing * [[Forgery]], the act of producing something that lacks authenticity with the intent to commit fraud or deception * Self-falsification, e.g., the [[Liar's paradox]] {{disambiguation}}
